fsm_perc_ht: ['Page 16:\n[¬s]"Most households (81.4%)\nwere comprised of single parents with incomes of less than 130% of the federal poverty line.[¬e]"']

fsm_info_ht:
['Page 19:
[¬s]"The premise of the conditional cash-transfer (CCT) programs is that families remain in poverty from one generation to the next because poor parents cannot invest adequately in their children."
"CCT programs deliberately target those most in need. Reaching the poorest and
vulnerable groups is the common thread among CCT programs that rely on both geographic
and household level targeting. They provide money to poor families contingent on
investments in human capital such as sending children to school and bringing them to health
centers on a regular basis.[¬e]"']

sample_analysed_ht:
['Page 13:
[¬s]"In each of these four
groups of 15 villages, we interviewed approximately 540 poor households randomly selected to
receive transfers. The control group consisted of 615 randomly selected poor households that did
not receive cash transfers in the 15 control villages where no households received transfers.[¬e]"']
fsm_info_info: Al households in the sample were poor, as this was a key variable the investigators were interested in.
fsm_info_ht:
['Page 13:
[¬s]"In our three survey rounds (baseline, one-year follow-up, two-year follow-up) conducted in June 2008, June 2009, and June 2010, we interviewed all poor households in each of the treatment villages who were randomly selected to receive the transfer."
"The control group consisted of 615 randomly selected poor households that did
not receive cash transfers in the 15 control villages where no households received transfers.[¬e]"']
attri_ht:
['Page 18:
[¬s]"Household attrition was extremely low between the baseline and one-year follow-up
survey (1.26 percent), and increased slightly when comparing the baseline and two-year follow-
up survey (3.56 percent).[¬e]"']

part_gen_info: No gender specified as a requirement for participation, mixed gender assumed
fsm_info_info: For purposes of this study, all participating households met the criteria for pocerty/low income.
fsm_info_ht:
['Page 19:
[¬s]"Program Keluarga Harapan targeted households classified as extremely poor (Rumah Tangga Sangat
Miskin, RTSM) by Statistics Indonesia using both economic and asset-based poverty measurements.17 To
create the initial beneficiary roster, Statistics Indonesia first surveyed poor and extremely poor
households, which were drawn from the 2005 BLT beneficiaries list (known as PPLS05). Approximately
30-40 percent of BLT beneficiaries were not included in the resulting roster. To minimize exclusion
errors they also conducted “sweepings” in targeted sub-districts, which involved interviewing poor
households with the intent to identify newly poor households that were not included in PPLS05.[¬e]"']
